name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Lead QA Automation Engineer
professional_summary: Utilized Java and Selenium to design automation frameworks for healthcare claims processing, reducing manual effort by ensuring consistent test execution across AWS environments, while mentoring team members on framework best practices.
Implemented BDD using Cucumber for insurance policy management systems, enhancing collaboration between QA and business teams, and ensuring tests were aligned with HIPAA compliance requirements.
Integrated CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins for banking application testing, achieving faster feedback loops and reducing deployment times by automating regression suites in Azure environments.
Developed hybrid frameworks combining data-driven and keyword-driven approaches for government portal testing, improving test coverage and maintainability while adhering to GDPR standards.
Led performance testing initiatives using JMeter for high-volume healthcare claims, identifying bottlenecks and optimizing system performance under load in AWS, ensuring scalability.

Collaborated with business SMEs to design end-to-end test cases for provider eligibility systems, ensuring comprehensive coverage and alignment with business requirements in HIPAA-compliant environments.
Coordinated UAT sessions with stakeholders for banking applications, ensuring smooth transitions to production and gathering feedback for iterative improvements in Azure-hosted systems.
Managed defect lifecycle using JIRA for healthcare insurance platforms, prioritizing and tracking issues to ensure timely resolution and maintaining system stability under PCI compliance.
Contributed to reusable framework components and shared libraries for insurance policy automation, promoting code reusability and reducing development time across AWS-based projects.
Executed regression, smoke, and functional tests for banking trade booking systems, ensuring system reliability and performance in Azure environments while adhering to PCI standards.
Performed post-deployment validation for government portals, ensuring system stability and user experience in AWS environments, and addressing issues promptly to minimize downtime.
Conducted load and stress testing for payment APIs in banking systems using JMeter, analyzing results to provide recommendations for system improvements in Azure environments.
Mentored QA team members on CI/CD integration and code review practices, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing across AWS and Azure projects.
Designed and implemented automation frameworks for healthcare provider portals, reducing manual testing efforts and improving test coverage while ensuring HIPAA compliance in AWS environments.
Built hybrid frameworks for insurance claims processing, combining data-driven and BDD models to enhance test flexibility and maintainability in AWS environments.
Collaborated with product owners to define test strategies for banking applications, ensuring alignment with business goals and delivering high-quality software in Azure environments.
Coordinated with business stakeholders to conduct UAT for government portals, ensuring system readiness and gathering feedback for final adjustments in AWS environments.
Analyzed performance test results for healthcare eligibility systems, identifying areas for optimization and ensuring system scalability under high-volume transactions in AWS environments.
